Full Stack Software Development Student

June 2016 - September 2016 Prime Digital Academy
  • Group Project - Dress for Success Twin Cities
    • Dress for Success Twin Cities (DFSTC) works to prepare low income women to enter the professional work force by connecting them with volunteers and mentors. The process is time consuming for DFSTC staff to schedule the appointments, call the clients and volunteers, and follow up multiple times. Also, the staff uses large spreadsheets to create manual reports about volunteers and appointments.
    • Our app works to eliminate the time consuming process for DFSTC staff by allowing volunteers and clients to seamlessly choose their own time slots, while giving the staff the visibility to see the few times where they may need to make a few calls to fill empty appointment slots. It also automates the numerous reports that the staff runs each day.
    • Technologies Used:
      • MongoDB, Express, AngularJS, Node.js, HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, Angular UI, Passport, bcrypt
  • Solo Project - Planventure
    • Planning for camping trips with groups can be tough to organize and redundant over time. Who is reponsible for what equipment, what equipment does an individual need for oneself, are there any special details, what is the meal plan; these are all examples of questions when planning a group trip.
    • Planventure is an app that allows users to easily create or join trips for groups. It is a collaborative environment that helps users plan efficiently and avoid overpacking. In addition, it can help remove the repetitive nature of creating new packing lists for each trip based on user preferences.
    • Technologies Used:
      • MongoDB, Express, AngularJS, Node.js, JavaScript, PostgreSQL, HTML5, CSS3, Google Maps API, Passport, Bootstrap, Gulp, bcrypt
